severe impairment of thallus growth and wilted before the formation of the gemma cup
(Figure S4B). This result suggests a much broader function for the sole Rop in
, which is evidently essential for the growth and development of the
gametophyte thallus. Another type of GEF, SPIKE1 (SPK1), has been reported to regulate
cytoskeletal rearrangement and cell-shape change in response to growth signals in
. SPK1 has a conserved DOCK homology region 2 (DHR2) domain,
which is distantly related to CZH [CDM (Ced-5, Dock180, Myoblastcity)-Zizimin
homology] RhoGEFs in animals and fungi [29].
[9] (Figure S4C), which may have a critical function in controlling
The contrast between the specific developmental impairment in
(Figure 1 and 2), and the ubiquitous promoter activity of
suggests an upstream regulatory mechanism for KAR activity, which enables cell-type
specific activation of Rop in the gemma initial. Recent studies have shown that several
plasma membrane-localized receptor-like protein kinases (RLKs) function as upstream
regulators of Rop signaling through interaction with the C-terminal variable region of
the pollen receptor kinases in tomato (
) [20, 21, 30]. Similar to their role in polarized cell growth mediated
by Rop signaling in angiosperms, RLK(s) might be involved in the specific function of
KAR in the initial stage of gemma development in
studies on the N-terminal and C-terminal variable regions of KAR will be needed to
understand the regulatory mechanism of Rop signaling in
